name: Agriculture and forestry support
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: agriculture and forestry support. name: Electricity generation – WTT
description: Emission intensity of WTT Electricity generation Africa (average). Well-to-Tank (WTT) conversion factors for UK and overseas electricity should be used to report the Scope 3 emissions of extraction and refining and transportation of primary fuels before their use in the generation of electricity. It should be noted that electricity generation and transmission and distribution losses have separate WTT emissions assigned to them. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

Well-to-Tank (WTT) conversion factors for UK and overseas electricity should be used to report the Scope 3 emissions of extraction and refining and transportation of primary fuels before their use in the generation of electricity. It should be noted that electricity generation and transmission and distribution losses have separate WTT emissions assigned to them. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Gas fired plant
description: Emission intensity for gas fired plant. The data scope includes upstream and combustion emissions. Retrieved from Base Carbone - Data V21.0.csv.

name: Geothermal energy
description: Emission intensity for geothermal energy. The data scope includes only upstream emissions for energy resource and the emissions related to the manufacture and maintenance of the production chain. The use of the primary energy source in itself is considered to be emission-free. Retrieved from Base Carbone - Data V21.0.csv.

name: Grid mix
description: Emission intensity for the Darwin Katherine Interconnected System (DKIS) grid mix. Published by the Australian Government 2021. Indirect (scope 2) emission factors for consumption of purchased electricity or loss of electricity from the grid.

name: Grid mix
description: Emission intensity of grid mix as reported. The values take electrical and thermal kWh supply into account. Cross-border power exchanges are not included. The publication covers only direct emissions from power plants. Provided by the IEA in 2013. Published by ADEME. NOTE: this value is provided in CO2 only and does not include the impact of other GHGs.

name: Grid mix
description: Emission intensity of electricity generated as reported. Retrieved from BEISs Greenhouse Gas Reporting: Conversion Factors 2021-flat file. These factors include only direct emissions at UK power stations and from autogenerators plus those from the proportion of imported electricity. They do not include emissions resulting from production and delivery of fuel to these power stations.

name: Grid mix
description: Emission intensity of grid mix as reported. The values take electrical and thermal kWh supply into account. Cross-border power exchanges are not included. The publication covers only direct emissions from power plants. Provided by the IEA in 2013. Published by ADEME. description: Emission intensity for oil steam plant. The data scope includes upstream and combustion emissions. Retrieved from Base Carbone - Data V21.0.csv.

name: Photovoltaic (Made in China)
description: Emission intensity for photovoltaic made in China. The data scope includes only upstream emissions for energy resource and the emissions related to the manufacture and maintenance of the production chain. The use of the primary energy source in itself is considered to be emission-free. If the country of production is not known the default value to be used is Photovoltaic electricity - China production. Retrieved from Base Carbone - Data V21.0.csv.

name: T&D - UK electricity
description: Emission intensity of T&D- UK electricity.Transmission and distribution (T&D) factors should be used to report the Scope 3 emissions associated with grid losses (the energy loss that occurs in getting the electricity from the power plant to the organisations that purchase it). Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Transmission & Distribution – WTT
description: Emission intensity of WTT Transmission & distribution Africa (average). Well-to-Tank (WTT) conversion factors for UK and overseas electricity should be used to report the Scope 3 emissions of extraction and refining and transportation of primary fuels before their use in the generation of electricity. It should be noted that electricity generation and transmission and distribution losses have separate WTT emissions assigned to them. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Agricultural byproducts
description: Emission intensity of stationary combustion of fuel. Includes fuel consumption at a facility to produce electricity/steam/heat or power. The primary source is EPA Emission Factors for Greenhouse Gas Inventories - Table 1 Stationary Combustion Emission Factors - March 9 2018. The CO2 factor represents the biogenic CO2 factor.

name: Anthracite coal
description: Emission intensity of stationary combustion of fuel. Includes fuel consumption at a facility to produce electricity/steam/heat or power. The primary source is EPA Emission Factors for Greenhouse Gas Inventories - Table 1 Stationary Combustion Emission Factors - March 9 2018.

name: Asphalt and road oil
description: Emission intensity of stationary combustion of fuel. Includes fuel consumption at a facility to produce electricity/steam/heat or power. The primary source is EPA Emission Factors for Greenhouse Gas Inventories - Table 1 Stationary Combustion Emission Factors - March 9 2018.

name: Aviation fuel (avgas)
description: Emission intensity of aviation gasoline. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020. Retrieved from 2020 Emission Factors Flat File.

name: Aviation fuel (avgas)
description: Emission intensity of aviation spirit fuel for piston-engined aircraft - a high octane petrol (aka AVGAS). The fuels conversion factors should be used for primary fuel sources combusted at a site or in an asset owned or controlled by the reporting organisation. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Aviation fuel (avgas)
description: Emission intensity for aviation fuel (avgas). name: Aviation fuel (avgas) WTT
description: Emission intensity for aviation fuel (avgas). Well-to-Tank (WTT) fuels conversion factors should be used to account for the upstream Scope 3 emissions associated with extraction and refining and transportation of the raw fuel sources to an organisation’s site (or asset) - prior to combustion. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Aviation fuel (avgas) WTT

name: Commuter rail passenger train
description: Emission intensity for commuter rail passenger train with no information on inclusion of upstream emissions. This emission factor accounts for commuter rail services between a central city and adjacent suburbs (also called regional rail or suburban rail). It is intended for use in the distance-based method defined in the GHG Protocol Scope 3 Calculation Guidance. If fuel data are available then the fuel-based method should be used. Retrieved from the EPA's GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx).

name: Intercity rail passenger NE corridor
description: Emission intensity for intercity rail passenger train (northeast corridor) with no information on inclusion of upstream emissions. This emission factor accounts for intercity rail services (long-distance rail between major cities such as Amtrak). The Northeast corridor extends from Boston to Washington D.C. Retrieved from the EPA's GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx).

name: Intercity rail passenger routes other than NE corridor
description: Emission intensity for intercity rail passenger train (other routes) with no information on inclusion of upstream emissions. This emission factor accounts for intercity rail services (long-distance rail between major cities such as Amtrak). Other Routes are all routes outside the Northeast Corridor. Retrieved from the EPA's GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx).

name: International rail passenger train
description: Emission intensity for international rail passenger train including fuel consumption. The international rail factor is based on a passenger-km weighted average of the conversion factors for the following Eurostar routes: London-Brussels/London-Paris/London-Marne Le Vallee (Disney)/London-Avignon/London-Amsterdam/London to Bourg-Saint-Maurice (ski train). The conversion factors were provided by Eurostar for the 2021 update together with information based on the electricity figures used in their calculation. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Light rail and tram passenger train
description: Emission intensity for light rail and tram passenger train including fuel consumption. The light rail factors were based on an average of factors for a range of UK tram and light rail systems. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Mainline train
description: Emission intensity for mainline train including upstream electricity generation and/or fuel combustion. Published by the Agence de l'Environnement et de la Maîtrise de l'Énergie. Retrieved from Base Carbone - Data V21.0.csv.

name: National average for intercity rail passenger
description: Emission intensity for for intercity rail passenger train with no information on inclusion of upstream emissions (national average). This emission factor accounts for intercity rail services (long-distance rail between major cities such as Amtrak). Retrieved from the EPA's GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx).

name: National average for urban passenger train
description: Emission intensity for urban passenger train (national average) including fuel consumption. Public transport passenger travel emission factors. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020. Retrieved from 2020 Emission Factors Flat File.

name: National rail passenger train
description: Emission intensity for UK national rail passenger train including fuel consumption. The national rail factor refers to an average emission per passenger kilometre for diesel and electric trains in 2019-20. The factor is sourced from information from the Office of the Rail Regulator’s National rail trends for 2019-20 (ORR 2020). This has been calculated based on total electricity and diesel consumed by the railway for the year sourced from the Association of Train Operating Companies (ATOC) and the total number of passenger kilometres (from National Rail Trends). Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: National urban passenger train
description: Emission intensity for diesel urban passenger train including fuel consumption. Public transport passenger travel emission factors. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Regional Express Train (Paris and suburbs)

name: RER (Paris area) and Transilien (suburban-train lines)

name: Subway or tram or trolley bus in urban area (below 250 000 inhabitants)

name: Tram (Île-de-France region)

name: Underground passenger train
description: Emission intensity for London underground passenger train including fuel consumption. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Urban passenger train
description: Emission intensity for average passenger train. This emission factor accounts for transit rail: rail typically within an urban center such as subways/elevated railways/Urban railways (metro)/streetcars/trolley cars/tramways.The method of calculation used is the distance-based method which involves determining the mass/distance/mode of each shipment then applying the appropriate mass-distance emission factor for the vehicle used. LCA activity is unknown. Retrieved from the EPA's GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx).

name: Average van (up to 3.5 tonnes)
description: Emission intensity of van with unknown fuel source (up to 3.5 tonnes) for road transport. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

description: Emission intensity of third-party transport in US dollars spend on: water freight. Retrieved from the Quantis+GHG Protocol Scope 3 Calculator.

name: Water transport
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (purchase of service/standard good/capital good) in US dollars spend on: water transport. Retrieved from the Quantis+GHG Protocol Scope 3 Calculator. name: Water transport (boats/ships/ferries)
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: water transport (boats/ships/ferries). name: Waterborne craft

name: Bus and coach fares

Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Waste management and remediation
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: waste management and remediation. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: Water supply
description: Emission intensity for water supply. Based on emissions associated with offices/transport/treatment of water supply. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Drinking water and wastewater treatment
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: drinking water and wastewater treatment. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: Water treatment
description: Emission intensity of water treatment in the UK in 2021. Based on emissions associated with offices/transport/treatment of wastewater. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.
